doc.title: Recommendation Changes
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-09/J.P. Morgan Best of ASEAN 29 Aug 25J.P. Morgan Best of ASEAN 29 Aug 25_2025-08-09

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
Best of ASEAN is a weekly spotlight on our most actionable research - encompassing equity strategy, economics, thematic, sector, and single- stock ideas
ASEAN Equity Strategy (Khoi Vu, CFA/Rajiv Batra), Global

The announcement of trade deals and new tariffs rates (19- 20% reciprocal tariffs in general, except 10% for Singapore) - has cleared uncertainties and improved sentiment in ASEAN, bolstering an \(\sim 8\%\) rally over the past two months. This performance has been led mainly by domestic investors whilst foreigners continue to remain on the sidelines. Only Indonesia received sizable inflows (US \(\) 262m\$ ) whilst the rest of ASEAN continued to see outflows, bringing net outflows to surpass US \(\) 12bn\(YTD, in - line with our previous cautious view. We believe the equity bull market will remain intact in the ASEAN region. In our base case, we expect lower interest rates, stimulative fiscal policies to boost domestic growth, seasonality (4Q - 1Q) and inexpensive valuation to support markets over the next 6 months. This should keep domestic investors favoring risk assets and remaining the key buyers. As foreign investors reassess U.S. exceptionalism and seek broader diversification, ASEAN equities should not be overlooked as potential portfolio diversifiers. Lastly, J.P. Morgan's FX team expects the U.S. dollar to likely weaken after a prolonged period of strength since 2010, which aligns with the interests of the current U.S. administration. A weaker U.S. dollar can further improve debt- servicing capacity by lowering dollar import bills and attracting foreign investment. We reiterate our new targets for ASEAN markets, preferring cyclicals over defensives. Our top picks are: DBS SP, CIMB MK, BDO PM, BBRI IJ, TCB VN, MPACT SP, CIT SP, ICT PM, CPALL TB, KTB TB, ANTM IJ.
Thai Hospitals (Kae Pornpunnarath, CFA), Thailand

The resumption of medical tourism revenue flow from Kuwait (6.5%/0.7% of BH/BDMS revenue in 2022) has been a topic of interest, though its timeline has remained uncertain. However, a series of recent events, as detailed below, are positive indicators that this long- awaited revenue stream may soon be revitalized. We recently upgraded BH to OW (link) as we believe the revenue momentum from the Middle East market could be reaching its lowest point and is poised for an upswing. This development is favorable for both BH and BDMS, in that order.
Indonesia Property (Henry Wibowo), Indonesia

We reiterate our positive view on the Indonesia Property sector, with CTRA and PwON our preferred picks. Over the past 1M/3M, CTRA/PWON have delivered 5- 12%/3- 13% outperformance vs MXID (see Indonesia Property: Better 2H25 Outlook). We believe this outperformance is likely to persist as the resumption of BI and Fed rate cuts fuels the narrowing of NAV discounts, which are still at historically low levels of 68/60% for CTRA/PWON despite the recent rally. Idiosyncratic factors could provide further boosts to returns, in our view. CTRA's fundamentals have been resilient and the stock is set to be a key

beneficiary of returning flows as the largest developer with a diversified presence in the country. PWON is on track to deliver \(>10\%\) YoY recurring income growth this year (80% of revenue) with a 12% FCF yield, opening up room to distribute higher dividends. We roll over our PTs to Dec- 26. CTRA's new PT of Rp1,480 (vs Rp1,400) offers \(+38\%\) potential upside, while PWON's new PT of Rp560 (vs Rp520 prior) implies \(+45\%\) potential upside.

Vietnam bank stocks are up \(40\%\) on average in the last 3M (vs. VNINDEX \(+25\%\) ) following the trade deal with the US (link). The operating outlook is positive, with strength in loan growth, and stabilizing asset quality and NIM. We are increasing EPS estimates by \(3 - 13\%\) for ACB/TCB/VPB. However, valuations are elevated, in select cases. Hence, we recommend staying invested for the medium term (link) but would re- position given recent moves. We upgrade ACB to OW post relative underperformance. NIM has bottomed, real estate conditions are improving in the South (link), and valuations remain attractive at \(1.26x\) 2026E PB for \(19.4\%\) average ROE in the next 3Y. Despite the improved outlook, we see negative risk- reward for VPB. The stock has moved to \(12.2x\) 12m fwd PER, or 2SD above mean; with any deceleration in exports posing risks to FE Credit. We are increasing our PT to VND28k, but downgrading to UW. We are increasing our PT for TCB to VND45k, as the bank's ROA advantage (2.5% average in next 3Y) is not fully reflected at current valuations. VCB remains our preferred pick ahead of potential FTSE re- classification. Please see our detailed note on VCB here.
Philippine Banks (Daniel Andrew Tan, CFA/Harsh Wardhan Modi), Philippines

Philippine bank stocks were down \(3.8\%\) today vs. PSEi - 2.2%, led by BDO (- 8%) and BPI (- 2% at close, but down \(4 - 5\%\) in midday trading), despite no company- specific news. This brings the last 3M decline to \(19\%\) for both BDO/BPI (vs. PSEi - 4%), following a weaker PHP, BSP rate cuts (25bps in June) and expectations of further cuts (25bps this week), which prompted a rotation within the Philippines to property stocks vs. banks (ALI PM \(+22\%\) in last 3M); as well as an underwhelming set of results for PH banks (costs at BDO, NPL coverage decline at BPI).
\(\blacktriangle\) | Asia Commercial Bank (Andrew Tan, CFA/Harsh Wardhan Modi) (ACB VN, OW, PT D33,000.00), Vietnam
Vietnam Banks: Repositioning amidst the rally; u/g ACB to OW, d/g VPB to UW
\(\blacktriangle\) | Berli Jucker PCL (Kae Pornpunnarath, CFA) (BJC TB, N, PT Bt18.00), Thailand
Upgrade to Neutral - Fairly Priced
\(\blacktriangledown\) | VPBank (Daniel Andrew Tan, CFA/Harsh Wardhan Modi) (VPB VN, UW, PT D28,000.00), Vietnam
Vietnam Banks: Repositioning amidst the rally; u/g ACB to OW, d/g VPB to UW
